meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be cleaned.
meanings.sent1: The cleanability of the kitchen floor made it easy to wipe away the spilled milk.
meanings.sent2: I chose this fabric for its cleanability, as it can be washed without shrinking.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape had such incredible cleanability that even mud couldn't stick to it!
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude had a cleanability that washed away any negativity around her.
meanings.sent5: The new cleaning product boasted unmatched cleanability, leaving surfaces sparkling with minimal effort.

meanings.definition: The ability to be easily cleaned or maintained.
meanings.sent1: The cleanability of the car's interior made it a breeze to keep tidy.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the cleanability of this blender, as it can be disassembled for thorough cleaning.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum's cleanability feature allowed it to clean up after itself, making it quite self-sufficient!
meanings.sent4: Her schedule had a cleanability that allowed her to easily fit in last-minute appointments.
meanings.sent5: The restaurant's dishes were chosen for their cleanability, ensuring quick turnover during busy hours.
